meanings.definition: To give up or surrender control or possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She cedes her seat to the elderly lady on the bus.
meanings.sent2: The king cedes his crown to the prince.
meanings.sent3: The cat cedes its favorite spot on the couch to the new kitten.
meanings.sent4: The sun cedes its place in the sky to the moon.
meanings.sent5: The student cedes the top spot in the class to her hardworking friend.

meanings.definition: To yield or grant something to another.
meanings.sent1: He cedes the last cookie to his little sister.
meanings.sent2: The company cedes control of the project to the experienced team.
meanings.sent3: The tree cedes its shade to the growing sapling beside it.
meanings.sent4: The river cedes its course to the newly formed tributary.
meanings.sent5: The athlete cedes the trophy to the deserving winner.
